sen.j: 日羅（にちら、？－583年12月）は、6世紀朝鮮半島にあった百済の王に仕えた日本人。
sen.e: Nichira (? - December, 583) was a Japanese who served the King of Baekje, which existed in the Korean peninsula in the sixth century.

sen.j: 父は火（肥後）葦北（現在の葦北郡と八代市）国造刑部靭部阿利斯登。
sen.e: His father was Osakabe no Yugei Arishito, who was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) of Ashikita (now Ashikita County and Yatsushiro City), Higo Province.

sen.j: 父阿利斯登は宣化天皇の代に朝鮮半島に渡海した大伴金村に仕えた九州出身の武人であった。
sen.e: His father Arishito was a warrior from Kyushu region and served OTOMO no Kanamura, who moved to the Korean peninsula in the reign of the Emperor Senka.

sen.j: 日羅は百済王から二位達率と極めて高い官位を与えられた倭系百済官僚であった。
sen.e: Nichira was a Japanese government official of Baekje, awarded very high court rank of Dachisochi, the second highest rank, by the King of Baekje.

sen.j: 敏達天皇の要請により583年日本に帰国し、朝鮮半島に対する政策について朝廷に奏上した。
sen.e: He returned to Japan in 583, upon the request of the Emperor Bidatsu, and advised the court about policies towards the Korean peninsula.
